operations.target_text: Guest Network Access: Visitors to the Company can access guest networks by registering with the office personnel, bypassing the need for a formal access request.
operations.comment: You indicated that you do not have an office, so this section should be removed. No office = no guest network needed; Having office = visitors need controlled network access for security.
You indicated you use Azure DevOps for version control, so this section should remain. No version control = no source code to protect; Using version control = IP protection needed.
You indicated you don't use any password management tool, so this section should be removed. No password tool = section removed; Using specific tool = policy references actual system.

operations.target_text: All requests will be sent by email to <email>
operations.replacement: All requests will be sent by email to the IT team
operations.comment: You selected email-based access requests with Github Issues for ticket management. Email = simple but no tracking; Ticketing system = proper audit trails; Chat = fast but informal; Manager approval = personal but creates bottlenecks.

You selected annual reviews instead of quarterly basis. We recommend quarterly reviews for most companies. If you operate in highly critical industries with complex or large company structure (1000+ employees), you might consider monthly reviews. Small companies and startups can get away with annual reviews. Pick any frequency that works for your company. Auditors only care that you consistently follow whatever schedule you document here.

You selected 8 business hours instead of 24 business hours. We recommend 24 business hours for most companies. Consider shorter timelines if customers request it. Longer than 1 week looks suspicious to auditors. You only get a non-conformity for not meeting your documented timeframe, not for choosing the wrong timeframe.

You indicated that Hassan is the owner of this access control policy, so the owner placeholder needs to be replaced. This person is the enforcer of the policy. If your employees have questions about the policy, that person should be easily identified by employees and prepared to answer any of their questions regarding the policy.

You indicated that the IT Manager is responsible for approving exceptions to this policy, so the IT Manager placeholder should be updated. Can be the same person as violations reporting section. Acceptable roles: CISO, CEO, CTO, IT Manager, or even HR Manager. For audit it's only important to define it. Auditors will not issue a non-conformity for wrong selection - select what works best for you here. But it needs to be consistently done by this person.
